radiographic_examinations.findings: Bilateral, predominantly central lung opacities, compatible with early pulmonary edema or inhalation injury.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: By day 3, the pulmonary opacities have worsened and are more diffuse, indicating the development of acute respiratory distress syndrome. By day 7, there is progressive clearing of pulmonary opacities.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Diffuse bilateral interstitial infiltrates, consistent with the development of acute respiratory distress syndrome.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: During the second week after the fire, there was clearing of the infiltrates on the chest radiographs.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Improvement of pulmonary opacities without evidence of developing air-space disease.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Despite a sputum culture positive for Pseudomonas aeruginosa, the radiograph showed improvement by day 18.

radiographic_examinations.date: During the second month after the fire
radiographic_examinations.findings: Large area of heterotopic bone posterior to the distal humerus.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: After surgery, the radiograph shows that the heterotopic bone has disappeared, indicating resection.
